--- layout: component title: Button description: Buttons are simple controls for executing in-page actions or navigating to another page. Use them for actions in forms, dialogs, modals and more. The button styles can also be applied to links when they need to stand out as a call to action. guidelines: do: - Use a button to execute a single or compound command - Use to style links that require special attention, like a call to action in a Billboard - Use to submit or cancel a form or dialog dont: - Use to adjust the value of an option - Use to select from among a group of independent or mutually exclusive options - Place buttons inline with a heading or paragraph of text contents: - Usage guidelines - Button tags - Color options - Disabled styles - Size options - Using icons ---
{% include example-intro.html title='Button tags' description='Use the button classes on a <button>, <a>, or <input> element. If an <a> element is used to act as a button — triggering in-page functionality, rather than navigating to another document or section within the current page — it should also be given an appropriate role="button". As a best practice, we highly recommend using the <button> element whenever possible to ensure matching cross-browser rendering.' %} {% capture example %} Link {% endcapture %} {% include example.html size='fourth' code=example id='code-button-tags' %}
